channel.title: Review on Tyler Smith
channel.description: Recent content in Review on Tyler Smith

item.title: Innovation at Universities
item.description: Who should have the rights to innovations created at a university: professors or the university? A natural answer would be the professors; they were the ones who came up with the idea in the first place! Well, that’s not how it works in the US. In the US, professors have rights to about a third of the income from patents and ventures started at universities. This arrangement is motivated by the fact that universities are a crucial partner in innovation; universities supply the basic research, resources, and environment needed to incubate risky ideas before it’s clear they are viable commercial ventures.
